Understanding PNG vs JPG

PNG (Portable Network Graphics) is a lossless format that supports transparency and is ideal for graphics, logos, and images with text. However, PNG files are typically larger in size.

JPG/JPEG (Joint Photographic Experts Group) uses lossy compression to create much smaller files, making it perfect for photographs and images where transparency isn't needed.

When to convert: Use this converter when you need smaller file sizes for web use, email attachments, or when uploading to platforms that don't support PNG.

Frequently Asked Questions

What happens to transparent backgrounds when converting PNG to JPG?

JPG format doesn't support transparency. When you convert a PNG with a transparent background to JPG, the transparent areas will be filled with a solid white background. If you need to preserve transparency, consider using WEBP format instead.

Will I lose image quality converting PNG to JPG?

JPG uses lossy compression, so there will be some quality loss, but it's usually imperceptible for photographs and most images. Our converter uses high-quality settings (90% quality) to minimize any visible degradation.

Is it safe to convert PNG to JPG using your tool?

Absolutely! This is a client-side tool - all conversion happens in your web browser using HTML5 Canvas technology. Your images are never uploaded to our servers.
